<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Mediates between ELFNix initialization and ExecutionSession state.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/elfnixplatform"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">ELFNixPlatform : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/platform">Platform</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Try to create a ELFNixPlatform instance, adding the ORC runtime to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// given JITDylib.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The ORC runtime requires access to a number of symbols in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// libc++. It is up to the caller to ensure that the required</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// symbols can be referenced by code added to PlatformJD. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// standard way to achieve this is to first attach dynamic library</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// search generators for either the given process, or for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// specific required libraries, to PlatformJD, then to create the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// platform instance:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code&#123;.cpp&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   auto &amp;PlatformJD = ES.createBareJITDylib(&quot;stdlib&quot;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   PlatformJD.addGenerator(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ExitOnErr(EPCDynamicLibrarySearchGenerator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 ::GetForTargetProcess(EPC)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ES.setPlatform(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ExitOnErr(ELFNixPlatform::Create(ES, ObjLayer, EPC, PlatformJD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                     &quot;/path/to/orc/runtime&quot;)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Alternatively, these symbols could be added to another JITDylib that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PlatformJD links against.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Clients are also responsible for ensuring that any JIT&#39;d code that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// depends on runtime functions (including any code using TLV or static</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// destructors) can reference the runtime symbols. This is usually achieved</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by linking any JITDylibs containing regular code against</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PlatformJD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// By default, ELFNixPlatform will add the set of aliases returned by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// standardPlatformAliases function. This includes both required aliases</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (e.g. &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;atexit -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;elf&#95;cxa&#95;atexit for static destructor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// support), and optional aliases that provide JIT versions of common</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// functions (e.g. dlopen -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;elf&#95;jit&#95;dlopen). Clients can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// override these defaults by passing a non-None value for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RuntimeAliases function, in which case the client is responsible for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// setting up all aliases (including the required ones).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
